document.title: ACT College and Career Readiness Standards - English

227E360CE81E4252AFEC1C3C4EEC1B7F.description: Use a colon to introduce an example or an elaboration

5F9A393386C14798A12F87BB9A31FA58.description: Delete punctuation around essential/restrictive appositives or clauses

B2C7025C4D4E43B3A77C6EED3BCEE1DB.description: Use a semicolon to link closely related independent clauses

BFD89617B3064C6A913CE154F390DE01.description: Use apostrophes to form possessives, including irregular plural nouns

57BC4548ADC34EEBB4623B1A7D33A586.description: Use punctuation to set off a nonessential/nonrestrictive appositive or clause

774E7E7AF5E045298294E1E023423142.description:
Use commas to avoid ambiguity when the syntax or language
is sophisticated (e.g., to set off a complex series of items)

0037E4090A71401EB3F7F0DEF25C1B1B.description: Use apostrophes to form simple possessive nouns

DCAC49FE01134133886068ED0626FC01.description: Use punctuation to set off complex parenthetical elements

0F15558E0BD646C09F0F36AEF558DA58.description: Â Recognize and correct inappropriate uses of colons and semicolons

0B85E0FA122B4C338AFFFCE435ECEECB.description:
Delete commas in long or involved sentences when an incorrect
understanding of the sentence suggests a pause that should be
punctuated (e.g., between the elements of a compound subject or
compound verb joined by and)

D4ABD71F9B814B56B393B0AB0732125C.description: Use commas to set off simple parenthetical elements

020EEF3D3254412087C82B66D820E342.description: Use commas to avoid obvious ambiguity (e.g., to set off a long introductory element from the rest of the sentence when a misreading is possible)

E82BAC474A5A41EE8C7BC2347040412A.description: Delete apostrophes used incorrectly to form plural nouns

1CB8A1621C714C23B2A044C803970995.description:
Delete commas when an incorrect understanding of the sentence
suggests a pause that should be punctuated (e.g., between verb and
direct object clause)

B1FF6B1F6AD044F3BA7118C58984D1E4.description: Use appropriate punctuation in straightforward situations (e.g., simple items in a series)

E333DB7A90034A9FA5F9C645B085DEE4.description:
Delete commas that markedly disturb sentence flow (e.g., between
modifier and modified element)

CBDABD853A024E798DFF04D100737A04.description:
Delete commas that create basic sense problems (e.g., between verb
and direct object)

77461CBE606F47939BB0397FD9C9B5C7.description: Use idiomatically and contextually appropriate prepositions in combination with verbs in situations involving sophisticated language or complex concepts

2E7A058B14524200B04874FB02FCAF16.description:
Ensure subject-verb agreement when a phrase or clause between
the subject and verb suggests a different number for the verb

6D0E0686A2AE4054B044D6C5FF64611F.description: Use the appropriate word in less-common confused pairs (e.g., allude and elude)

7BF197ADE95642DEAAB0D75CE1C9DA69.description: Correctly use reflexive pronouns, the possessive pronouns its and your, and the relative pronouns who and whom

9A125FFDFCC849E69FA2A17649BA3937.description:
Ensure subject-verb agreement in some challenging situations
(e.g., when the subject-verb order is inverted or when the subject
is an indefinite pronoun)

286C25B609294EC684451FE71E5B8DC6.description: Recognize and correct vague and ambiguous pronouns

725A685F777349F6A0EB37523A76E62D.description: Ensure pronoun-antecedent agreement when the pronoun and antecedent occur in separate clauses or sentences

D3B3BF22482343448D29161337FCAFBB.description:
Form simple and compound verb tenses, both regular
and irregular, including forming verbs by using have rather than of
(e.g., would have gone, not would of gone)

9132F899E0074ABA85125C35874B7629.description: Recognize and correct expressions that deviate from idiomatic English

CD7A5A09CCB44287861A468BADFD4182.description: Use idiomatically appropriate prepositions, especially in combination with verbs (e.g., long for, appeal to)

052DB833D37E4632BC9F1855DAFFADCA.description: Ensure subject-verb agreement when there is some text between the subject and verb

A282C55F0A36424EA8427DCB6BC5C326.description:
Use the correct comparative or superlative adjective or adverb form
depending on context (e.g., âHe is the oldest of my three brothersâ)

00E0D1607F1140EAA55134EE5FEAE4B2.description: Use the appropriate word in frequently confused pairs (e.g., there and their, past and passed, led and lead)

37B8E8DD784746FBA9CE27C9B1ECD1DE.description: Use idiomatically appropriate prepositions in simple contexts

86966F63CB3E47EABA2173EFDC7DACDB.description:
Determine whether an adjective form or an adverb form is called
for in a given situation

EF8DFEE119D340C78B6851DC507D336C.description:
Form the past tense and past participle of irregular but commonly
used verbs

180D2E483D384D2BADA655815FE9A9D7.description:
Recognize and correct very subtle disturbances in sentence structure
(e.g., weak conjunctions between independent clauses, run-ons that
would be acceptable in conversational English, lack of parallelism within
a complex series of phrases or clauses)

5AEA4D2CCE614E3AA7AD7A3D7280CE2D.description: Maintain consistent and logical verb tense and voice and pronoun person on the basis of the paragraph or essay as a whole

4065BF377F1D4D50953588BFF2343D5D.description:
Recognize and correct subtle disturbances in sentence structure
(e.g., danglers where the intended meaning is clear but the sentence is
ungrammatical, faulty subordination and coordination of clauses in long
or involved sentences)

1A2AFF42DA03442291FF2FD547075676.description: Â Maintain consistent and logical verb tense and pronoun person on the basis of the preceding clause or sentence

428B492DD54342C295BA67117C5F769F.description:
Recognize and correct disturbances in sentence structure (e.g., faulty
placement of phrases, faulty coordination and subordination of clauses,
lack of parallelism within a simple series of phrases)

6AF77C4FE7734D4B9737B9C6EFC415C1.description:
Recognize and correct marked disturbances in sentence structure
(e.g., faulty placement of adjectives, participial phrase fragments, missing
or incorrect relative pronouns, dangling or misplaced modifiers, lack of
parallelism within a simple series of verbs)

AB007419D75842E4B6B068776884D5A2.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense and voice when the meaning of the entire sentence must be considered

338C590C7E344758815E977D9BE513F6.description:
Determine the need for punctuation or conjunctions to correct awkwardsounding
fragments and fused sentences as well as obviously
faulty subordination and coordination of clauses

8BF0D817325C4967887DB1495CF9EA2D.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense between simple clauses in a sentence or between simple adjoining sentences

98362381F4B74E128EE7DE7216EF87DA.description: Determine the need for punctuation or conjunctions to join simple clauses

FC10DB3E6B334D7B9226B36555A7F48A.description: Use the word or phrase most appropriate in terms of the content of the sentence when the vocabulary is sophisticated

FFAC9F9106764C8193AAD8E74B356084.description:
Delete redundant and wordy material that involves sophisticated language
or complex concepts or where the material is redundant in terms
of the paragraph or essay as a whole

0C9F4049B5D14F19A2A1BF6C38DABA94.description: Use the word or phrase most appropriate in terms of the content of the sentence when the vocabulary is fairly sophisticated

C2F8E025C3F14F2D90F620DA54E8582F.description: Determine the need for conjunctions to create subtle logical links between clauses

00E3202A442142F69BF61C467AC7B928.description: Delete redundant and wordy material that involves fairly sophisticated language (e.g., âthe outlook of an aesthetic viewpointâ) or that sounds acceptable as conversational English

56632C542F374BA186B6EEBF76A248D6.description:
Revise vague, clumsy, and confusing writing involving sophisticated
language

A706C2DF9D8945639E6F3013A2844536.description: Use the word or phrase most appropriate in terms of the content of the sentence when the vocabulary is uncommon

4EB2B377FD484C299B5FA315891E71C1.description: Determine the need for conjunctions to create logical links between clauses

98F51F87617346089E72309A1AD3972F.description: Revise expressions that deviate in subtle ways from the style and tone of the essay

51192EB632984F85B429F8B5DB867773.description: Delete redundant and wordy material when the meaning of the entire sentence must be considered

11C1906270654BC3AAA50DE542A1F536.description: Revise vague, clumsy, and confusing writing

A06654871C9540FFB6F71EB68EFCF420.description: Use the word or phrase most appropriate in terms of the content of the sentence when the vocabulary is relatively common

F9557053BF0840D09C1C8B7F1FA523CA.description: Determine the need for conjunctions to create straightforward logical links between clauses

6B27244CC4544A1DAB26541143FA6C6B.description: Revise expressions that deviate from the style and tone of the essay

09CC5DEF1B9A428490D0A2A2ED501753.description:
Delete redundant and wordy material when the problem is contained
within a single phrase (e.g., âalarmingly startled,â âstarted by reaching
the point of beginningâ)

B3A4D3303DCE4BAE8CB8505161F92433.description: Revise expressions that deviate markedly from the style and tone of the essay

A34DFBA5BA754CE0BBC04B81CB6DA3CD.description: Delete obviously redundant and wordy material

E95E8BF1426B40BCACCDDB0AAA2BE730.description:
Revise vague, clumsy, and confusing writing that creates obvious
logic problems

31AB864E896443A08E7F351516920DC5.description: Provide a sophisticated introduction or conclusion to or transition within a paragraph or essay, basing decisions on a thorough understanding of the paragraph and essay (e.g., linking the conclusion to one of the essayâs main images)

B4D900B90576432AB42DDE434B318771.description:
Determine the need for transition words or phrases, basing decisions
on a thorough understanding of the paragraph and essay

0108178CDC3E424F8AABD23AAC001930.description: Rearrange the sentences in a fairly complex paragraph for the sake of logic and coherence

7BA52C4F632544BBB94365F74B070D49.description: Provide a subtle introduction or conclusion to or transition within a paragraph or essay (e.g., echoing an essayâs theme or restating the main argument)

5A5D3FD5E8AF4914BE2C8CD1F7F7257F.description: Determine the most logical place for a sentence in a fairly complex essay

3A9A3478BA064EF0B85CC9DD7591E931.description:
Determine the need for transition words or phrases to establish subtle
logical relationships within and between paragraphs

7B90F8DCB11B4BCC9F26DDE383CD1545.description: Rearrange the paragraphs in an essay for the sake of logic

51B2F40ED05441BAAE7468BF1505B694.description: Determine the best place to divide a paragraph to meet a particular rhetorical goal

71FF1F325EC044E9B2EF9C63A92C9891.description: Rearrange the sentences in a fairly straightforward paragraph for the sake of logic

EC878E45A8F34B3EA5104D1DBF9646A5.description: Provide a fairly straightforward introduction or conclusion to or transition within a paragraph or essay (e.g., supporting or emphasizing an essayâs main idea)

EEB85329D4C04FEA812ADFDB6A959C30.description:
Determine the need for transition words or phrases to establish subtle
logical relationships within and between sentences (e.g., therefore,
however, in addition)

873A38F04FD249A9954D96B0A88482A6.description: Â Rearrange the sentences in a straightforward paragraph for the sake of logic

EDAB7DC95CEB4FEA8E5047D44E9E8295.description: Â Provide a straightforward conclusion to a paragraph or essay (e.g., summarizing an essayâs main idea or ideas)

AA2779E1F0D34F98B97D21ACA9498CE0.description: Â Provide an introduction to a straightforward paragraph

510E096BB44141E2B89DC52B99A3012E.description: Â Determine the most logical place for a sentence in a straightforward essay

0954A7F98079425D91E2589636081B63.description:
Determine the need for transition words or phrases to establish
straightforward logical relationships (e.g., first, afterward, in response)

4D97EA62460D49B7853BE0EAD0F04287.description: Â Provide a simple conclusion to a paragraph or essay (e.g., expressing one of the essayâs main ideas)

05236350D2AE487CA1525023F20CD7FF.description: Determine the most logical place for a sentence in a paragraph

E88F8661D83A423F9950300A058DA694.description:
Determine the need for transition words or phrases to establish time
relationships in simple narrative essays (e.g., then, this time)

88704640973E48C0B0BE70165CD5118D.description: Use a word, phrase, or sentence to accomplish a complex purpose, often in terms of the focus of the essay

64C9C5CF6D3946F8BB68F4A505F6E14F.description: Determine whether a complex essay has met a specified goal

6C9D00E8DB634288A566FD3C73B1B804.description:
Identify the purpose of a word, phrase, or sentence when the purpose
is complex (e.g., anticipating a readerâs need for background information)
or requires a thorough understanding of the paragraph and essay

980765D534C04B95BD59D1D0C867CA48.description: Use a word, phrase, or sentence to accomplish a subtle purpose (e.g., adding emphasis or supporting detail, expressing meaning through connotation)

627882ECA1B14BF78F14428971F08385.description: Identify the purpose of a word, phrase, or sentence when the purpose is subtle (e.g., supporting a later point, establishing tone) or when the best decision is to delete the text in questionÂ

8A4052A21B554DDDB868B35A98E55181.description:
Determine relevance when considering material that is plausible but
potentially irrelevant at a given point in the essay

1606C214DF6242989B48CFB9F10B3C4B.description: Use a word, phrase, or sentence to accomplish a fairly straightforward purpose (e.g., sharpening an essayâs focus, illustrating a given statement)

40E4ADF13389492B8826830F24908148.description: Determine whether an essay has met a specified goal

1FE8FC8260FE47B4BC1C7CECA0A6A95F.description:
Identify the purpose of a word, phrase, or sentence when the purpose
is fairly straightforward (e.g., identifying traits, giving reasons, explaining
motivations)Â

82718B1E4D79458D899EB112213BF0D7.description: Determine relevance of material in terms of the focus of the paragraph

50F2E34B713F45BEAA99B89CE6ED84BF.description:
Use a word, phrase, or sentence to accomplish a straightforward purpose
(e.g., conveying a feeling or attitude)

1446F4A4ACE4444C951F0FAEB6565F91.description:
Identify the purpose of a word or phrase when the purpose is
straightforward (e.g., describing a person, giving examples)

B62EB96BDD6E449C978A58DB2AEDC019.description: Determine relevance of material in terms of the focus of the essay

475114F270684CD59BD2B7EF099402C5.description: Determine whether a simple essay has met a straightforward goal

9925B187C3544B66BC39E69DA0EFD976.description:
Identify the purpose of a word or phrase when the purpose is simple
(e.g., identifying a person, defining a basic term, using common
descriptive adjectives)

027B5BD712AF43B1B6D19E20C36F491E.description:
Delete material because it is obviously irrelevant in terms of the focus
of the essay

CAD48867EF62484182D8C4AF10F82EA8.description:
Delete material because it is obviously irrelevant in terms of the topic
of the essay

947AFF332E8D4B0EAAF589451D775FCF.description: Topic Development in terms of Purpose and Focus
